name: Faith No More
description:
Faith No More. No more faith—in what? Try: in the lies of religion, corporate culture, the discourses of governments and commercialism. Faith No More because there was faith at one time. It is faith lost. Disillusionment. It’s, I used to believe your lies and now I throw them in your face. Sarcasm. Bitterness. Very black and biting humor. There’s room in artistry for such emotions as long as they don’t become an all-consuming cancer, and with FNM something like the opposite happens. Art functions as a form of healing—or at least as a salve to the wound.

4500 X 5700 pixels
